com.tokelon.toktales.desktop.ui.window

Interface IWindow

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LWJGLWindow

    public interface IWindow
    Represents a native window on a device.

    A window must be created by using create() before any methods are called on it. In addition, certain methods may only be called if the window is visible.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Creates this window as a native window.
      void destroy()
      Destroys this window as a native window.
      void detachContext()

      Sets the value for the given attribute of this window.
      void setBorderless()
      Sets this window to borderless fullscreen mode on the current monitor as specified by getCurrentMonitor().
      void setBorderless(long monitor)
      Sets this window to borderless fullscreen mode on the given monitor.
      void setFullscreen()
      Sets this window to fullscreen mode on the current monitor as specified by getCurrentMonitor().

      Sets this window to fullscreen mode on the given monitor.
      void setInputMode(int mode, int value)
      Sets the value for the given input mode of this window.
      void setMonitor(long monitor)
      Sets the monitor configuration of this window to the given monitor, while keeping all sane values from the current configuration.
      void setMonitor(long monitor, int xpos, int ypos, int width, int height, int refreshRate)
      Sets the monitor configuration of this window to the given values.
      void setPosition(int x, int y)
      Sets the position of this window to the given position in screen coordinates.
      void setSize(int width, int height)
      Sets the size of this window to the given size in screen coordinates.
      void setSwapInterval(int interval)
      Sets the buffer swap interval for this window.
      void setTitle(String title)
      Sets the title of this window to the given title.
      void setWindowed()
      Sets this window to windowed mode, using the last known position and size.
      void setWindowed(int x, int y, int width, int height)
      Sets this window to windowed mode, using the given size and position in screen coordinates.
      void setWindowed(long monitor, int width, int height)
      Sets this window to windowed mode, using the given size in screen coordinates and while moving it to the top-left corner of the given monitor.
      boolean shouldClose()
      Returns whether the user has requested for this window to close.
      void show()
      Makes this window visible.
      void swapBuffers()
      Requests for the frame buffers of this window to be swapped.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        void create()
        Creates this window as a native window.

        This should always be the first call on this object.

      • show

        void show()
        Makes this window visible.

        Note that certain methods may only be called if the window is visible.

      • hide

        void hide()
        Makes this window invisible.

        Note that certain methods may only be called if the window is visible.

      • destroy

        void destroy()
        Destroys this window as a native window.

        This method should be called to free any resources used by this window.

      • shouldClose

        boolean shouldClose()
        Returns whether the user has requested for this window to close.
        Returns:
        True if this window should close, false if not.

      • makeContextCurrent

        void makeContextCurrent()
        Makes the context of this window current on the calling thread.

        A context must only be current on a single thread a a time and each thread can have only a single current context at a time.

      • detachContext

        void detachContext()
        Detaches any native window context from the calling thread.

      • swapBuffers

        void swapBuffers()
        Requests for the frame buffers of this window to be swapped.
        See Also:
        setSwapInterval(int)

      • getId

        long getId()
        Returns:
        The identifier of this window.
        Throws:
        WindowException - If this window has not been initialized by create().

      • getWidth

        int getWidth()
        Returns:
        The width of this window in screen coordinates.
        See Also:
        getFrameBufferWidth()

      • getHeight

        int getHeight()
        Returns:
        The height of this window in screen coordinates.
        See Also:
        getFrameBufferHeight()

      • getPositionX

        int getPositionX()
        Returns:
        The horizontal position of the upper-left corner of this window in screen coordinates.

      • getPositionY

        int getPositionY()
        Returns:
        The vertical position of the upper-left corner of this window in screen coordinates.

      • getTitle

        String getTitle()
        Returns:
        The title of this window.

      • getMonitor

        long getMonitor()
        Returns:
        The monitor identifier for this window, or 0 if none is set.

      • getSwapInterval

        int getSwapInterval()
        Returns:
        The buffer swap interval for this window.

      • getInputMode

        int getInputMode(int mode)
        Parameters:
        mode -
        Returns:
        The value for the given input mode of this window.

      • getAttribute

        int getAttribute(int attribute)
        Parameters:
        attribute -
        Returns:
        The value for the given attribute of this window.

      • getFrameBufferWidth

        int getFrameBufferWidth()
        Returns:
        The frame buffer width of this window in pixels.

      • getFrameBufferHeight

        int getFrameBufferHeight()
        Returns:
        The frame buffer height of this window in pixels.

      • isVisible

        boolean isVisible()
        Returns:
        True if this window is visible, false if not.

      • isFullscreen

        boolean isFullscreen()
        Returns:
        True if this window is in fullscreen mode, false if not.

      • isBorderless

        boolean isBorderless()
        Returns:
        True if this window is in borderless fullscreen mode, false if not.

      • getCurrentMonitor

        long getCurrentMonitor()
        Returns the monitor this window is currently on, on a best-guess basis.

        As a general rule that will be the monitor on which this window covers the most area on.

        Returns:
        The identifier for the monitor this window is currently on.

      • setSize

        void setSize(int width,
             int height)
        Sets the size of this window to the given size in screen coordinates.
        Parameters:
        width -
        height -

      • setPosition

        void setPosition(int x,
                 int y)
        Sets the position of this window to the given position in screen coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -

      • setTitle

        void setTitle(String title)
        Sets the title of this window to the given title.
        Parameters:
        title -

      • setMonitor

        void setMonitor(long monitor)
        Sets the monitor configuration of this window to the given monitor, while keeping all sane values from the current configuration.
        Parameters:
        monitor -

      • setMonitor

        void setMonitor(long monitor,
                int xpos,
                int ypos,
                int width,
                int height,
                int refreshRate)
        Sets the monitor configuration of this window to the given values.
        Parameters:
        monitor -
        xpos -
        ypos -
        width -
        height -
        refreshRate -

      • setSwapInterval

        void setSwapInterval(int interval)
        Sets the buffer swap interval for this window.

        The interval specifies the minimum number of screen updates to wait for until the buffers are swapped. This is also called vertical synchronization.

        Parameters:
        interval -

      • setInputMode

        void setInputMode(int mode,
                  int value)
        Sets the value for the given input mode of this window.
        Parameters:
        mode -
        value -

      • setAttribute

        void setAttribute(int attribute,
                  int value)
        Sets the value for the given attribute of this window.
        Parameters:
        attribute -
        value -

      • setWindowed

        void setWindowed()
        Sets this window to windowed mode, using the last known position and size.

        Generally the last known position and size are from when the screen mode was previously switched to something other than windowed.

      • setWindowed

        void setWindowed(long monitor,
                 int width,
                 int height)
        Sets this window to windowed mode, using the given size in screen coordinates and while moving it to the top-left corner of the given monitor.
        Parameters:
        monitor -
        width -
        height -

      • setWindowed

        void setWindowed(int x,
                 int y,
                 int width,
                 int height)
        Sets this window to windowed mode, using the given size and position in screen coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        width -
        height -

      • setFullscreen

        void setFullscreen()
        Sets this window to fullscreen mode on the current monitor as specified by getCurrentMonitor().

      • setFullscreen

        void setFullscreen(long monitor)
        Sets this window to fullscreen mode on the given monitor.
        Parameters:
        monitor -

      • setBorderless

        void setBorderless()
        Sets this window to borderless fullscreen mode on the current monitor as specified by getCurrentMonitor().

        Sets this window to borderless fullscreen mode on the given monitor.
